result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jose L. Ramirez Jr.

records.addlTxt:
2:13 PM Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jose L. Ramirez Jr. in court.  Attorney Chad Shamali appears on behalf of Attorney Alyssah M Foster in court for Jose L. Ramirez Jr. Spanish interpreter, Leo Martin, appeared in court. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Attorney Shamali advises the Court that the matter is resolved and is requesting a plea/sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
PT for 9/15/22 adjourned to 10/10/22 at 2:00 pm on court's motion; court unavailable on previously scheduled date.  Confirming email sent to parties.
Pre-trial conference on October 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on September 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Due to the ongoing trial in br 2 the PTC of 07/13/22 at 3:30 has been adjourned with Attorney Bub to 09/15/22 at 10:00.

NO RECORD MADE. Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney C Bub. Interpreter Leo Martin appeared to interpret for deft. Clerk/H. Barnett.  State in victim rights compliance. Atty Bub states he is new on the case and does not have all the discovery. PTC set for 7/13/22 at 3:30pm. Bond continued.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: El Rodeo  1361 - 52nd Street, Alan M. C. R., Francisco R. and Genevieve M.

02:06 PM  
  Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Benjamin Schwarz.  Interpreter Leo Martin.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.    Plea of Not Guilty entered.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.  $500  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).    jk
